author: Emily Van de Riet
title: Woman says her Stanley cup saved her life from a stray bullet
text: Woman says her Stanley cup saved her life from a stray bullet STEUBENVILLE, Ohio (Gray News/TMX) ‚Äì A woman in Ohio claims her Stanley tumbler saved her from being hit by a stray bullet. A 22-year-old named Rachel posted about the Feb. 12 incident on TikTok, which has since gone viral. Rachel told TMX she and her fianc√© David were inside their home in the city of Steubenville when they heard gunshots outside. She said they heard about seven or eight gunshots and then one ‚Äúreally loud bang‚Äù from a bullet that came through the wall of the house and ricocheted off her Stanley tumbler, which was sitting directly in front of her. After bouncing off the Stanley cup, the bullet changed direction and went through a bottle of perfume before landing on the kitchen floor, Rachel said. The couple said they hid until police officers arrived. Rachel‚Äôs [video on TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@xo._ray/video/7334832760600726830) documents the path of the bullet, showing the hole through her wall, the mark on her Stanley cup where the bullet bounced off, and the hole in her perfume bottle. The video also shows the bullet on her kitchen floor. While some TikTok users questioned the authenticity of the claims, Rachel posted [a follow-up video ](https://www.tiktok.com/@xo._ray/video/7334935703710731562)showing police in her home, investigating the scene. Gray News has reached out to Steubenville police for comment. However, some fellow Stanley fans were not surprised to hear that their favorite cup was indestructible, even against a bullet. ‚ÄúWho needs body armor? Just grab your Stanley,‚Äù one TikTok user wrote. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm convinced Stanleys are immortal,‚Äù another wrote. Copyright 2024 Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved. TMX contributed to this report.

author: @DeptofDefense
title: National Security Advisor: Ukraine Is Successfully Defending Against Russia > U.S. Department of Defense > Defense Department News
text:
National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan speaks at the NATO summit in Washington, July 11, 2024. Share: √ó Share Copy Link Email Facebook X LinkedIn WhatsApp Download: Full Size ( 194.56 KB ) Photo By: Screen capture VIRIN: 240711-O-D0439-002
A few months ago, Ukrainian soldiers on the front lines were running out of artillery shells and were having to ration them, said National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan today at the NATO summit in Washington.
"The situation looked extremely grim," he said.
Spotlight: NATO
Then, security funding for Ukraine passed in Congress after a delay.
Since then, the picture has changed considerably. Russia's offensive in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv stalled out. Russia is continuing to throw wave after wave of men into the fight, making incremental gains at astonishing human and financial cost. By and large, the front lines have stabilized," Sullivan said.
Ukrainian mobilization efforts have improved. Ukrainian units are building stronger fortifications and defensive lines, and day by day, they're pushing back, he said.
National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan speaks at the NATO summit in Washington, July 11, 2024. Share: √ó Share Copy Link Email Facebook X LinkedIn WhatsApp Download: Full Size ( 184.32 KB ) Photo By: Screen capture VIRIN: 240711-O-D0439-001
"This is due to the people of Ukraine, to their sheer courage and commitment to their country and its freedom. But it's also due to the support of the United States and nations around the world, including NATO allies," Sullivan said.
The national security advisor said over the last few months, the United States has surged air defense systems, artillery rounds and long-range missiles.
The Ukrainians are employing these weapons with good effect in Russian-occupied areas of Ukraine, including in Crimea," he said.
Training Time U.S. and Norwegian soldiers train Ukrainian artillerymen on using an M109 self-propelled howitzer at Grafenwoehr Training Area, Germany, May 12, 2022. The U.S. and Norwegian soldiers trained the Ukrainian artillerymen on the howitzers as part of security assistance packages from their respective countries. Share: √ó Share Copy Link Email Facebook X LinkedIn WhatsApp Download: Full Size ( 102.4 KB ) Photo By: Sgt. Spencer Rhodes, Army VIRIN: 220512-Z-EG775-294
Allies have committed to collectively providing Ukraine with at least 40 billion euros worth of security assistance over the next year, including tanks, armored fighting vehicles, artillery, missiles, and a range of other capabilities that Ukraine needs to be able to affect effectively fight and win, Sullivan said.
The U.S., in partnership with allies, will provide Ukraine with air defense missiles and systems that are especially relevant to help protect Ukrainian forces on the front lines, civilians and the energy grid, he said.
Also, the United States, Denmark and the Netherlands have begun the transfer of F-16 fighter jets to Ukrainian forces, which will be operating in Ukraine this summer, according to a White House statement yesterday.
National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan speaks at the NATO summit in Washington, July 11, 2024. Share: √ó Share Copy Link Email Facebook X LinkedIn WhatsApp Download: Full Size ( 174.08 KB ) Photo By: Screen capture VIRIN: 240711-O-D0439-004
Sullivan said Russian President Vladimir Putin thinks he can outlast Ukraine and its supporters, and he's taken steps to put Russia's entire economy on a wartime footing with help from Iran, North Korea and China.
Russia's unsustainable war spending masks underlying weakness and fragility, and the economic costs for Russia are mounting and will compound over time, he said.
Meanwhile, NATO allies have been making historic investments in their own defense industrial bases, he said, as well as increasing defense spending.
This year, Ukraine, with the support of the United States and other allies and partners, has made remarkable diplomatic progress as well, he said, including bilateral defense security cooperation agreements between Ukraine and some 20 allies, designed for long-term assistance.
National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan speaks at the NATO summit in Washington, July 11, 2024. Share: √ó Share Copy Link Email Facebook X LinkedIn WhatsApp Download: Full Size ( 184.32 KB ) Photo By: Screen capture VIRIN: 240711-O-D0439-003
"The road ahead will be challenging. President Putin is determined to keep trying to take over Ukraine, and countries like Iran, North Korea and China are cheerleading him. We're clear eyed about all of that, but we are also clear eyed about Ukraine's strengths and resilience," he said.
Spotlight: Support for Ukraine

author: Las Dos Orillas
title: 5 planes para realizar en Bogot√° en el Puente de Reyes
text:
En la temporada decembrina, decenas de personas salieron de la ciudad para disfrutar de sus vacaciones y de otros paisajes m√°s rodeados de naturaleza. Sin embargo, hay quienes decidieron quedarse en Bogot√°, porque no ten√≠an recursos para salir o para apreciar la soledad de las calles. Para aquellos que est√°n regresando y para quienes prefirieron estar en la capital, le mostramos algunos planes en Bogot√° que se har√°n el puente festivo.
Del 6 al 8 de enero habr√° una variedad de actividades culturales y recreativas para disfrutar en familia en diferentes escenarios de la ciudad, algunas de estas ser√°n gratuitas.
| Vea tambi√©n:
El mejor plan a una hora de Bogot√° para escalar una roca gigante y comer delicioso
- Jard√≠n Bot√°nico
Muchas personas pudieron disfrutar del Festival de luces ‚ÄòMajestuosos‚Äô en diciembre, pero para quienes no han podido ir, este show ir√° hasta el 14 de enero. Este evento invita a los asistentes a explorar los ecosistemas colombianos, iluminados de forma espectacular. Las puertas se abren de 6:00 a 10:00 durante el s√°bado, domingo y el lunes festivo, y las entradas se pueden adquirir en el lugar o de forma virtual en
su p√°gina web.
- Cinemateca
Este 6, 7 y 8 de enero 2024 progr√°mese con el buen cine que presenta la Cinemateca de Bogot√°. Las funciones, seg√∫n el distrito, prometen historias cautivadoras y se pueden consultar horarios espec√≠ficos para cada fecha en la plataforma de la Cinemateca.
La jornada estar√° marcada por distintas producciones cinematogr√°ficas tanto nacionales como internacionales tales como ‚ÄòLas aventuras de Maurice‚Äô, ‚ÄòLa otra forma‚Äô, ‚ÄòClose‚Äô, ‚ÄòLa sociedad de la nieve‚Äô, ‚ÄòLa vendedora de rosas‚Äô y muchas m√°s.
Recuerde que para adquirir tus boletas puedes hacerlo directamente en el nombre de cada funci√≥n, o en la taquilla de la Cinemateca.

Este domingo 7 de enero se proyectar√°n pel√≠culas como Las aventuras de Maurice, Hojas de oto√±o, Los reyes del mundo y m√°s. üëáüèΩ
 [January 3, 2024]
- Exposiciones de arte
Se presenta la exposici√≥n ‚ÄòF.L.E.S.H.‚Äô del artista Felipe Lozano, que mediante escultura y video explora la intersecci√≥n entre pornograf√≠a y capitalismo, con la colaboraci√≥n de inteligencia artificial. La muestra estar√° disponible los d√≠as 6, 7 y 8 de enero en la Sala E de la Cinemateca de Bogot√° (carera 3 No. 19 - 10) con entrada libre de 11:00 a. m. a 6:00 p. m.
Tambi√©n se presentar√° la exposici√≥n ‚ÄòEspejo de luz‚Äô, en conmemoraci√≥n de los 20 a√±os de la Ley de Cine en Colombia, esta destaca c√≥mo el cine ha moldeado la identidad del pa√≠s y su influencia en la cultura, sociedad y pol√≠tica colombiana. Estar√° disponible los d√≠as 6, 7 y 8 de enero en la Galer√≠a de la Cinemateca de Bogot√° (Carrera 3 No. 19 - 10) con entrada libre de 11:00 a. m. a 6:00 p. m.
- Ciclov√≠a
El Instituto Distrital de Recreaci√≥n y Deporte (IDRD) invit√≥ a participar en la tradicional ciclov√≠a el domingo 7 y lunes 8 de enero. El evento promueve la movilidad activa y sostenible, y se extiende de 7:00 a. m. a 2:00 p. m.

Conoce los parques en los que estaremos, horarios y m√°s informaci√≥n en:
üîßüö≤ [#Bogot√°Pedalea] [#Bogot√°SeActiva] [pic.twitter.com/AFi8Jx94vQ] [December 24, 2023]
- Planetario de Bogot√°
En el domo del Planetario de Bogot√° se proyectar√° la pel√≠cula ‚ÄòRuta Leyenda El Dorado‚Äô, una cinta para analizar la conexi√≥n entre el ser humano y el cosmos. Las funciones ser√°n los 3 d√≠as a las 11:00 a.m., las 12:00 p.m., las 2:00 p.m, las 3:00 a.m. y las 5:00 p.m.
Adem√°s, se realizar√°n shows musicales con efectos de luces en diversas funciones que incluyen tributos a Queen, Arctic Monkeys, Coldplay y Michael Jackson. Las entradas se pueden adquirir en las taquillas del planetario. Puede conocer toda
la programaci√≥n a trav√©s de su p√°gina web.

author: maitl
title: La presse argentine souligne la port√©e historique mondiale de la victoire de Dien Bien Phu
text: Cette victoire est n√©e de la force de la grande solidarit√© nationale sous la direction du Parti et du Pr√©sident H√¥ Chi Minh. Le site Internet ABC Mundial souligne que cette victoire a non seulement mis fin au colonialisme fran√ßais au Vietnam, mais a √©galement laiss√© une marque ind√©l√©bile dans l‚Äôhistoire de l‚Äôhumanit√©. Il y a soixante-dix ans, du 13 mars au 7 mai, le peuple et l'arm√©e du Vietnam, sous la direction du Parti communiste du Vietnam (PCV) dirig√© par le pr√©sident H√¥ Chi Minh, menaient la bataille strat√©gique et d√©cisive de Dien Bien Phu, aboutissant √† une victoire qui ¬´ a retenti sur les cinq continents et a secou√© le monde ¬ª, marquant un grand tournant dans l'histoire de la lutte du peuple vietnamien pour construire et d√©fendre le pays. L'auteur de l'article a affirm√© que cette victoire est un symbole de la r√©sistance globale du peuple vietnamien. De la r√©sistance sur le champ de bataille aux luttes politiques, √©conomiques et diplomatiques, tous les pans de la soci√©t√© vietnamienne se sont unis pour expulser les envahisseurs. /

author: Bdaily Business News
title: Businesses sponsor innovative children\u2019s mental health programme
text: Businesses sponsor innovative children‚Äôs mental health programme A group of North East businesses is tackling the growing mental health crisis among children by sponsoring an innovative storytelling intervention to improve wellbeing. This year, [Muckle LLP](https://www.muckle-llp.com), [Ryder Architecture](https://www.ryderarchitecture.com), [Sorella Sorella](https://sorellasorella.com) and [Square One Law](https://squareonelaw.com) are sponsoring MELVA, an award-winning programme developed by creative learning charity [Mortal Fools](https://www.mortalfools.org.uk). MELVA uses storytelling, engaging characters, and interactive activities to teach children vital mental health skills, such as emotional literacy and resilience, through annual school licenses. Maria Brooks, director of operations at Square One Law, said: ‚ÄúNow, more than ever, supporting young people‚Äôs mental health is absolutely crucial, and Mortal Fools is leading the way with their innovative MELVA programme. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre happy to play a small part in helping to bring MELVA to local schools - by using storytelling to teach practical wellbeing techniques, they make mental health accessible and engaging for children.‚Äù Her comments were echoed by Nicola Leyden, director of HR at Muckle LLP, who added: ‚ÄúWe are delighted to have been able to support Mortal Fools through its MELVA programme for a second year. ‚ÄúThe work they do in encouraging young people to increase their knowledge and understanding of mental health and connect with a language enabling them to talk about this openly is extremely important and is something we wholeheartedly support through our grant funding here at Muckle.‚Äù Responding to alarming statistics from Public Health England, which reveal that one in five UK children face mental health challenges, MELVA serves as a preventative resource accessible to all children, focusing on early intervention and self-management techniques. As Richard Wise, partner at Ryder Architecture, suggests: ‚ÄúMELVA has never been more relevant. It tackles issues of anxiety, confidence and mental health in an imaginative and engaging way. ‚ÄúAt a time when school budgets are being squeezed more than ever, support from local businesses enables children and young people across the region and beyond to benefit from the programme.‚Äù Kiz Crosbie, Mortal Fools CEO & artistic director, added: ‚ÄúSponsorship from compassionate and civic-minded businesses has enabled us to remove significant barriers for schools to access MELVA, placing effective mental health resources directly into the hands of the children who need it most. ‚ÄúThe more businesses like this we work with, the more children we can reach. We would love more businesses to invest in MELVA, so we can reach even more young people.‚Äù Looking to promote your product/service to SME businesses in your region? [ Find out how Bdaily can help ‚Üí ](https://marketing.bdaily.co.uk) Enjoy the read? Get Bdaily delivered. Sign up to receive our daily bulletin, sent to your inbox, for free.
